00051 
00052 ## @brief The Screen class is a widget that provides an easy way of handling multiple views.
00053 #
00054 # This class is capable of managing various views of the same model and provides
00055 # functions for moving to the next and previous record.
00056 #
00057 # If neither setViewTypes() nor setViewIds() are called, form and tree views (in this order)
00058 # will be used. If you use only a single 'id' and say it's a 'tree', one you try to switchView
00059 # the default 'form' view will be shown. If you only want to show the 'tree' view, use 
00060 # setViewTypes( [] ) or setViewTypes( ['tree'] )
00061 # When you add a new view by it's ID the type of the given view is removed from the list of
00062 # view types. (See: addViewById() )
00063 #
00064 # A Screen can emit four different signals:
00065 #   activated() -> Emited each time a record is activated (such as a double click on a list).
00066 #   closed() -> Emited when a view asks for the screen to be closed (such as a 'close' button on a form).
00067 #   currentChanged() -> Emited when the current record has been modified. 
00068 #   recordMessage(int,int,int) -> Emited each time the current record changes (such as moving to previous or next).
00069 class Screen(QScrollArea):
00070 
00071         def __init__(self, parent=None):
00072                 QScrollArea.__init__(self, parent)
00073                 self.setFocusPolicy( Qt.NoFocus )
00074 
00075                 # GUI Stuff
00076                 self.setFrameShape( QFrame.NoFrame )
00077                 self.setWidgetResizable( True )
00078                 self.container = QWidget( self )
00079                 self.setWidget( self.container )
00080 
00081                 self.container.show()
00082 
00083                 self.searchForm = SearchFormWidget(self.container)
00084                 self.connect( self.searchForm, SIGNAL('search()'), self.search )
00085                 self.connect( self.searchForm, SIGNAL('keyDownPressed()'), self.setFocusToView )
00086                 self.searchForm.hide()
00087                 self.containerView = None
00088 
00089                 self.toolBar = ToolBar(self)
00090                 self.setToolbarVisible( False )
00091 
00092                 self.viewLayout = QVBoxLayout()
00093 
00094                 self.layout = QHBoxLayout()
00095                 self.layout.setSpacing( 0 )
00096                 self.layout.setContentsMargins( 0, 0, 0, 0 )
00097                 self.layout.addLayout( self.viewLayout )
00098                 self.layout.addWidget( self.toolBar )
00099 
00100                 vLay = QVBoxLayout( self.container )
00101                 vLay.setContentsMargins( 0, 0, 0, 0 )
00102                 vLay.addWidget( self.searchForm )
00103                 vLay.addLayout( self.layout )
00104 
00105                 # Non GUI Stuff
00106                 self.actions = []
00107 
00108                 self._embedded = True
00109 
00110                 self.views_preload = {}
00111                 self.rpc = None
00112                 self.name = None
00113                 self.views = {}
00114                 self.fields = {}
00115                 self.group = None
00116                 self._currentRecordPosition = None
00117                 self._currentRecord = None
00118                 self._currentView = -1
00119                 self._previousView = -1
00120 
00121                 self._viewQueue = ViewQueue()
00122                 self._readOnly = False
00123                 # The first time Screen is shown it will try to setCurrentRecord 
00124                 # if none is selected.
00125                 self._firstTimeShown = True
00126 
00127         def showEvent(self, event):
00128                 if self._firstTimeShown:
00129                         self._firstTimeShown = False
00130                         # The first time Screen is shown/rendered we'll set current record
00131                         # if none is yet selected. Note that this means that it's not possible
00132                         # to explicitly make Screen NOT select any items.
00133                         #
00134                         # The reason for doing this is that it allows delayed loading of embedded
00135                         # one2many and many2many fields because those not in the main tab won't 
00136                         # receive the 'showEvent' and won't try to load data from the server, which
00137                         # greatly improves load time of some forms.
00138                         #
00139                         # If we don't do this here, and let 2many widgets to try to implement it,
00140                         # they have to set current record on switchView, but the problem is that 
00141                         # label is kept as 0/0 (instead of 1/3, for example), until user clicks 
00142                         # switch view.
00143                         if self.group and self.group.count() and not self.currentRecord():
00144                                 self.setCurrentRecord( self.group.recordByIndex( 0 ) )
00145                 return QScrollArea.showEvent(self, event)
00146 
00147         ## @brief Sets the focus to current view.
00148         def setFocusToView(self):
00149                 self.currentView().setFocus()
00150 
00151         def sizeHint(self):
00152                 return self.container.sizeHint()
00153 
00154         def setPreloadedViews(self, views):
00155                 self.views_preload = views
00156 
00157         def preloadedViews(self, views):
00158                 return self.views_preload
00159                 
00160         ## @brief Initializes the list of views using a types list and an ids list.
00161         #
00162         # Example: 
00163         # 
00164         # screen.setupViews( ['tree','form'], [False, False] )
00165         def setupViews(self, types, ids):
00166                 self._viewQueue.setup( types, ids )
00167                 # Try to load only if model group has been set
00168                 if self.name:
00169                         self.switchView()
00170 
00171         def setViewIds(self, ids):
00172                 self._viewQueue.setViewIds( ids )
00173                 # Try to load only if model group has been set
00174                 if self.name:
00175                         self.switchView()
00176 
00177         def viewIds(self):
00178                 return self._viewIds
00179 
00180         def setViewTypes(self, types):
00181                 self._viewQueue.setViewTypes( types )
00182                 # Try to load only if model group has been set
00183                 if self.name:
00184                         self.switchView()
00185 
00186         ## @brief Sets whether the screen is embedded.
00187         #
00188         # Embedded screens don't show the search or toolbar widgets.
00189         # By default embedded is True so it doesn't load unnecessary forms.
00190         def setEmbedded(self, value):
00191                 self._embedded = value
00192                 self.setToolbarVisible( not value )
00193                 self.setSearchFormVisible( not value )
00194 
00195         ## @brief Returns True if the Screen acts in embedded mode.
00196         def embedded(self):
00197                 return self._embedded
00198 
00199         ## @brief Allows making the toolbar visible or hidden.
00200         def setToolbarVisible(self, value):
00201                 self._toolbarVisible = value
00202                 self.toolBar.setVisible( value )
00203 
00204         ## @brief Allows making the search form visible or hidden.
00205         def setSearchFormVisible(self, value):
00206                 self._searchFormVisible = value
00207                 self.searchForm.setVisible( value )
00208                 if value:
00209                         if self.currentView() and self.currentView().showsMultipleRecords():
00210                                 self.loadSearchForm()
00211 
00212         def loadSearchForm(self):
00213                 if self.currentView().showsMultipleRecords() and not self._embedded: 
00214                         if not self.searchForm.isLoaded():
00215                                 form = Rpc.session.execute('/object', 'execute', self.resource, 'fields_view_get', False, 'form', self.context)
00216                                 tree = Rpc.session.execute('/object', 'execute', self.resource, 'fields_view_get', False, 'tree', self.context)
00217                                 fields = form['fields']
00218                                 fields.update( tree['fields'] )
00219                                 arch = form['arch']
00220 
00221                                 # Due to the fact that searchForm.setup() requires an XML and we want it to
00222                                 # be able to process select=True from both form and tree, we need to fake
00223                                 # an XML.
00224 
00225                                 dom = xml.dom.minidom.parseString(tree['arch'].encode('utf-8'))
00226                                 children = dom.childNodes[0].childNodes
00227                                 tempArch = ''
00228                                 for i in range(1,len(children)):
00229                                         tempArch += children[i].toxml()
00230                                 ##Generic case when we need to remove the last occurance of </form> from form view
00231                                 arch = arch[0:form['arch'].rfind('</form>')]
00232                                 ##Special case when form is replaced,we need to remove </form>
00233                                 index = arch.rfind('</form>')
00234                                 if index > 0:
00235                                         arch = arch[0:index]
00236                                 arch = arch + tempArch + '\n</form>'
00237 
00238                                 self.searchForm.setup( arch, fields, self.resource, self.group.domain() )
00239 
00240                         if self.searchForm.isEmpty():
00241                                 self.searchForm.hide()
00242                         else:
00243                                 self.searchForm.show()
00244                 else:
00245                         self.searchForm.hide()
00246 
00247         def setReadOnly(self, value):
00248                 self._readOnly = value
00249                 self.display()
00250 
00251         def isReadOnly(self):
00252                 return self._readOnly
00253 
00254         ## @brief This function is expected to be used as a slot for an Action trigger signal.
00255         # (as it will check the sender). It will call the Action.execute(id,ids) function.
00256         def triggerAction(self):
00257                 # We expect a Screen.Action here
00258                 action = self.sender()
00259 
00260                 # If record has been modified save before executing the action. Otherwise:
00261                 # - With new records nothing is done without notifying the user which isn't intuitive.
00262                 # - With existing records it prints (for example) old values, which isn't intuitive either.
00263                 if self.isModified():
00264                         if not self.save():
00265                                 return
00266 
00267                 # Do not trigger action if there is no record selected. This is
00268                 # only permitted for plugins.
00269                 if not self.currentId() and action.type() != 'plugin':
00270                         return
00271 
00272                 id = self.currentId()
00273                 ids = self.selectedIds()
00274 
00275                 if action.type() != 'relate':
00276                         self.save()
00277                         self.display()
00278 
00279                 context = self.context.copy()
00280                 if self.currentRecord():
00281                         # Plugins may be executed even if there's no current record.
00282                         context.update( self.currentRecord().get() )
00283 
00284                 action.execute( id, ids, context )
00285 
00286                 if action.type() != 'relate':
00287                         self.reload()
00288 
00289         ## @brief Sets the current widget of the Screen
00290         def setView(self, widget):
00291                 if self.containerView:
00292                         self.disconnect(self.containerView, SIGNAL("activated()"), self.activate )
00293                         self.disconnect(self.containerView, SIGNAL("currentChanged(PyQt_PyObject)"), self.currentChanged)
00294                         self.disconnect(self.containerView, SIGNAL("statusMessage(QString)"), self, SIGNAL("statusMessage(QString)") )
00295                         self.containerView.hide()
00296 
00297                 self.containerView = widget
00298                 # Calling first "loadSearchForm()" because when the search form is hidden
00299                 # it looks better to the user. If we show the widget and then hide the search
00300                 # form it produces an ugly flickering.
00301                 self.loadSearchForm()
00302                 self.containerView.show()
00303                 self.connect(widget, SIGNAL("activated()"), self.activate )
00304                 self.connect(widget, SIGNAL("currentChanged(PyQt_PyObject)"), self.currentChanged)
00305                 self.connect(widget, SIGNAL("statusMessage(QString)"), self, SIGNAL("statusMessage(QString)") )
00306 
00307                 # Set focus proxy so other widgets can try to setFocus to us
00308                 # and the focus is set to the expected widget.
00309                 self.setFocusProxy( self.containerView )
00310 
00311                 self.ensureWidgetVisible( widget )
00312                 self.updateGeometry()
00313 
00314         def activate( self ):
00315                 self.emit( SIGNAL('activated()') )
00316 
00317         def close( self ):
00318                 self.emit( SIGNAL('closed()') )
00319 
00320         ## @brief Searches with the current parameters of the search form and loads the
00321         # models that fit the criteria.
00322         def search( self ):
00323                 QApplication.setOverrideCursor( Qt.WaitCursor )
00324                 try:
00325                         value = self.searchForm.value()
00326                         self.group.setFilter( value )
00327                         # We setCurrentRecord( None ) first because self.group.update()
00328                         # can emit some events that can be used to query the currentRecord().
00329                         # Previous record may not exist and cause an exception.
00330                         self.setCurrentRecord( None )
00331                         self.group.update()
00332                         if self.group.count() > 0:
00333                                 self.setCurrentRecord( self.group.recordByIndex( 0 ) )
00334                         else:
00335                                 self.setCurrentRecord( None )
00336                         self.display()
00337                 except Rpc.RpcException, e:
00338                         pass
00339                 QApplication.restoreOverrideCursor()
00340 
00341         def updateSearchFormStatus(self):
00342                 # Do not allow searches if group is modified. This avoids 'maximum recursion' errors if user
00343                 # tries to search after modifying a record in an editable list.
00344                 if self.group.isModified():
00345                         self.searchForm.setEnabled( False )
00346                 else:
00347                         self.searchForm.setEnabled( True )
00348 
00349         # Slot to recieve the signal from a view when the current item changes
00350         def currentChanged(self, model):
00351                 self.setCurrentRecord( model )
00352                 self.emit( SIGNAL('currentChanged()') )
00353                 self.updateSearchFormStatus()
00354 
00355         ## @brief Sets the RecordGroup this Screen should show.
00356         # @param group RecordGroup object.
00357         def setRecordGroup(self, group):
00358                 if not group:
00359                         self.group = None
00360                         self._currentRecord = None
00361                         self._currentRecordPosition = None
00362                         # Call setCurrentRecord() after setting self.group
00363                         # because it will emit a signal with the count of elements
00364                         # which must be 0.
00365                         self.setCurrentRecord( None )
00366                         return
00367 
00368                 self.name = group.resource
00369                 self.resource = group.resource
00370                 self.context = group.context()
00371                 self.rpc = RpcProxy(self.resource)
00372 
00373                 self.group = group
00374                 self._currentRecord = None
00375                 self._currentRecordPosition = None
00376 
00377                 group.addFields(self.fields)
00378                 self.fields.update(group.fields)
00379                 
00380                 if self.isVisible():
00381                         if self.group and self.group.count() and not self.currentRecord():
00382                                 self.setCurrentRecord( self.group.recordByIndex( 0 ) )
00383                         else:
00384                                 # Note that we need to setCurrentRecord so it is initialized and
00385                                 # emits the recordMessage() signal.
00386                                 self.setCurrentRecord( None )
00387 
00388                         self._firstTimeShown = False
00389                 else:
00390                         self._firstTimeShown = True
00391 
00392         ## @brief Returns a reference the current record (Record).
00393         def currentRecord(self):
00394                 # Checking _currentRecordPosition before count() can save a search() call to the server because
00395                 # count() will execute a search() in the server if no items have been loaded yet. What happens is
00396                 # that the first time a screen with a TreeView is shown currentRecord() will be called but there
00397                 # will be no currentRecord. TreeView then will set the appropiate order by loading settings from 
00398                 # the server through restoreViewSettings, and KooModel will load data on demand.
00399                 if self._currentRecordPosition >= 0 and self.group.count():
00400                         # In some cases self._currentRecordPosition might point to a position
00401                         # beyond group size. In this case ensure current record is set to None.
00402                         if self._currentRecordPosition >= self.group.count():
00403                                 self.setCurrentRecord( None )
00404                                 return None
00405                         # Use modelByIndex because this ensures all missing fields of the model
00406                         # are loaded. For example, the model could have been loaded in tree view
00407                         # but now might need more fields for form view.
00408                         return self.group.modelByIndex( self._currentRecordPosition )
00409                 else:
00410                         # New records won't have that problem (althouth the problem might be that
00411                         # fields haven't been created yet??)
00412                         return self._currentRecord
00413 
00414         ## @brief Sets the current record.
00415         #
00416         # Note that value will be a reference to the Record.
00417         def setCurrentRecord(self, value):
00418                 if self.group and self.group.recordExists( value ):
00419                         pos = self.group.indexOfRecord( value )
00420                 else:
00421                         pos = -1
00422                 # In order to "discover" if we need to update current record we 
00423                 # use "self._currentRecordPosition", because setRecordGroup sets
00424                 # self._currentRecordPosition = None and then calls setCurrentRecord( None )
00425                 # Which will make pos = -1 and will emit the recordMessage() signal.
00426                 #
00427                 # Trying to "discover" this with self._currentRecord will not work.
00428                 if self._currentRecordPosition == pos:
00429                         return
00430                 self._currentRecord = value
00431                 self._currentRecordPosition = pos
00432                 if value and value.id:
00433                         id = value.id
00434                 else:
00435                         id = -1
00436                 if self.group:
00437                         count = self.group.count()
00438                 else:
00439                         count = 0
00440                 self.emit(SIGNAL('recordMessage(int,int,int)'), pos, count, id)
00441                 if self._currentRecord:
00442                         if self.currentView():
00443                                 self.currentView().setSelected( self._currentRecord )
00444 
00445         ## @brief Switches the current view to the previous one. If viewType (such as 'calendar') 
00446         # is given it will switch to that view type.
00447         def switchView(self, viewType = None):
00448                 if self.currentView(): 
00449                         self.currentView().store()
00450 
00451                 if self.currentRecord() and ( not self.group.recordExists( self.currentRecord() ) ):
00452                         self.setCurrentRecord( None )
00453 
00454                 if viewType:
00455                         self._previousView = self._currentView
00456                         self._currentView = self._viewQueue.indexFromType( viewType )
00457                 else:
00458                         if self._currentView >= 0:
00459                                 # Swap currentView and previousView values
00460                                 self._currentView, self._previousView = self._previousView, self._currentView
00461                         else:
00462                                 self._currentView = 0
00463                         # The second time switchView is executed, currentView might get -1
00464                         # and we want it in fact to be 1 ...
00465                         self._currentView = abs(self._currentView)
00466                         # ... unless there's only one view
00467                         self._currentView = min(self._currentView, self._viewQueue.count()-1)
00468 
00469                 # If the view can show multiple records we set the default loading method in the
00470                 # record group, otherwise we set the load one-by-one mode, so only the current record
00471                 # is loaded. This improves performance on switching views from list to form with forms
00472                 # that contain a lot of fields.
00473                 if self.currentView().showsMultipleRecords():
00474                         self.group.setLoadOneByOne( False )
00475                 else:
00476                         self.group.setLoadOneByOne( True )
00477 
00478                 self.setView( self.currentView() )
00479                 if self.currentRecord():
00480                         self.currentRecord().setValidate()
00481                 self.display()
00482 
00483         ## @brief Adds a view given it's id and type.
00484         #
00485         # This function is needed to resemble server's fields_view_get function. This 
00486         # function wasn't necessary but accounting module needs it because it tries to
00487         # open a view with it's ID but reimplements fields_view_get and checks the view
00488         # type.
00489         #
00490         # @see AddViewById
00491         # @see AddViewByType
00492         def addViewByIdAndType(self, id, type, display=False):
00493                 if type in self.views_preload:
00494                         return self.addView( self.views_preload[type]['arch'], self.views_preload[type]['fields'], display, toolbar=self.views_preload[type].get('toolbar', False), id=self.views_preload[type].get('view_id',False) )
00495                 else:
00496                         # By now we set toolbar to True always. Even when the Screen is embedded.
00497                         # This way we don't force setting the embedded option in the class constructor
00498                         # and can be set later.
00499                         view = self.rpc.fields_view_get(id, type, self.context, True)
00500                         return self.addView( view['arch'], view['fields'], display, toolbar=view.get('toolbar', False), id=view.get('view_id',False) )
00501                 
00502         ## @brief Adds a view given its id.
00503         # @param id View id to load or False if you want to load given view_type.
00504         # @param display Whether you want the added view to be shown (True) or only loaded (False).
00505         # @return The view widget
00506         # 
00507         # @see AddViewByType
00508         # @see AddViewByIdAndType
00509         def addViewById(self, id, display=False):
00510                 # By now we set toolbar to True always. Even when the Screen is embedded.
00511                 # This way we don't force setting the embedded option in the class constructor
00512                 # and can be set later.
00513                 view = self.rpc.fields_view_get(id, False, self.context, True)
00514                 return self.addView(view['arch'], view['fields'], display, toolbar=view.get('toolbar', False), id=id)
00515                 
00516         ## @brief Adds a view given a view type.
00517         # @param type View type ('form', 'tree', 'calendar', 'graph'...). 
00518         # @param display Whether you want the added view to be shown (True) or only loaded (False).
00519         # @return The view widget
00520         #
00521         # @see AddViewById
00522         # @see AddViewByIdAndType
00523         def addViewByType(self, type, display=False):
00524                 if type in self.views_preload:
00525                         return self.addView( self.views_preload[type]['arch'], self.views_preload[type]['fields'], display, toolbar=self.views_preload[type].get('toolbar', False), id=self.views_preload[type].get('view_id',False) )
00526                 else:
00527                         # By now we set toolbar to True always. Even when the Screen is embedded.
00528                         # This way we don't force setting the embedded option in the class constructor
00529                         # and can be set later.
00530                         view = self.rpc.fields_view_get(False, type, self.context, True)
00531                         return self.addView( view['arch'], view['fields'], display, toolbar=view.get('toolbar', False), id=view.get('view_id',False) )
00532                 
00533         ## @brief Adds a view given it's XML description and fields
00534         # @param arch XML string: typically 'arch' field returned by model fields_view_get() function.
00535         # @param fields Fields dictionary containing each field (widget) properties.
00536         # @param display Whether you want the added view to be shown (True) or only loaded (False)
00537         # @param toolbar Toolbar information as returned from fields_view_get server function.
00538         # @param id View id. This parameter is used for storing and loading settings for the view. If id=False, no
00539         #               settings will be stored/loaded.
00540         # @return The view widget
00541         def addView(self, arch, fields, display=False, toolbar=None, id=False):
00542                 if toolbar is None:
00543                         toolbar = {}
00544                 def _parse_fields(node, fields):
00545                         if node.nodeType == node.ELEMENT_NODE:
00546                                 if node.localName=='field':
00547                                         attrs = Common.nodeAttributes(node)
00548                                         if attrs.get('widget', False):
00549                                                 if attrs['widget']=='one2many_list':
00550                                                         attrs['widget']='one2many'
00551                                                 attrs['type'] = attrs['widget']
00552                                         try:
00553                                                 fields[attrs['name']].update(attrs)
00554                                         except:
00555                                                 print "-"*30,"\n malformed tag for :", attrs
00556                                                 print "-"*30
00557                                                 raise                                           
00558                         for node2 in node.childNodes:
00559                                 _parse_fields(node2, fields)
00560                 dom = xml.dom.minidom.parseString(arch.encode('utf-8'))
00561                 _parse_fields(dom, fields)
00562 
00563                 self.group.addFields(fields)
00564 
00565                 self.fields = self.group.fields
00566 
00567                 dom = xml.dom.minidom.parseString(arch.encode('utf-8'))
00568                 view = ViewFactory.create(id, self, self.resource, dom, self.fields)
00569                 self.viewLayout.addWidget( view )
00570                 self.setOnWriteFunction( view.onWriteFunction() )
00571                 # Load view settings
00572                 if not self.group.updated:
00573                         domain = self.group.domain()
00574                         self.group.setDomainForEmptyGroup()
00575                         view.setViewSettings( ViewSettings.load( view.id ) )
00576                         self.group.setDomain( domain )
00577                 else:
00578                         view.setViewSettings( ViewSettings.load( view.id ) )
00579 
00580                 self.views[ view.viewType() ] = view
00581                 self.loadActions( toolbar )
00582 
00583                 if display:
00584                         if not self._viewQueue.typeExists( view.viewType() ):
00585                                 self._viewQueue.addViewType( view.viewType() )
00586                         self._currentView = self._viewQueue.indexFromType( view.viewType() )
00587                         self.currentView().display(self.currentRecord(), self.group)
00588                         self.setView(view)
00589                 return view
00590 
00591         ## @brief Loads all actions associated with the current model including plugins.
00592         def loadActions( self, actions ):
00593                 self.actions = ActionFactory.create( self, actions, self.resource )
00594                 if self.actions:
00595                         for action in self.actions:
00596                                 self.connect( action, SIGNAL('triggered()'), self.triggerAction )
00597                         # If there's only one action it will be the 'Print Screen' action
00598                         # that is added "manually" by ActionFactory. In those cases in which
00599                         # Print Screen is the only action we won't show it in the toolbar. We
00600                         # don't consider Plugins a good reason to show the toolbar either.
00601                         # This way dashboards won't show the toolbar, though the option will
00602                         # remain available in the menu for those screens that don't have any
00603                         # actions configured in the server, but Print Screen can be useful.
00604                         if len(self.actions) > 1 + len(Plugins.list(self.resource)) and Settings.value('koo.show_toolbar') and self._toolbarVisible:
00605                                 self.toolBar.setup( self.actions )
00606                                 self.toolBar.show()
00607                         else:
00608                                 self.toolBar.hide()
00609 
00610         ## @brief Creates a new record in the current model. If the current view is not editable
00611         # it will automatically switch to a view that allows editing.
00612         def new(self, default=True, context=None):
00613                 if context is None:
00614                         context = {}
00615 
00616                 if self.currentView() and self.currentView().showsMultipleRecords() \
00617                                 and self.currentView().isReadOnly():
00618                         self.switchView( 'form' )
00619 
00620                 ctx = self.context.copy()
00621                 ctx.update( context )
00622                 record = self.group.create( default, self.newRecordPosition(), self.group.domain(), ctx )
00623 
00624                 if self.currentView():
00625                         self.currentView().reset()
00626 
00627                 self.setCurrentRecord( record )
00628                 self.display()
00629 
00630                 if self.currentView():
00631                         self.currentView().startEditing()
00632                 return self.currentRecord()
00633 
00634         ## @brief Returns 0 or -1 depending on new records policy for the current view.
00635         # If the view adds on top it will return 0, otherwise it will return -1
00636         def newRecordPosition(self):
00637                 if self.currentView() and self.currentView().addOnTop():
00638                         return 0
00639                 else:
00640                         return -1 
00641 
00642         ## @brief Returns whether new records will be added on top or on the bottom.
00643         #
00644         # Note that this is a property defined by the current view. If there's no current view
00645         # it will return False.
00646         def addOnTop(self):
00647                 if self.currentView():
00648                         return self.currentView().addOnTop()
00649                 else:
00650                         return False
00651 
00652         ## @brief Sets the on_write function. That is the function (in the server) that must
00653         # be called after storing a record.
00654         def setOnWriteFunction(self, functionName):
00655                 self.group.setOnWriteFunction( functionName )
00656 
00657         ## @brief Stores all modified models.
00658         def save(self):
00659                 if not self.currentRecord():
00660                         return False
00661                 self.currentView().store()
00662                 
00663                 id = False
00664                 if self.currentRecord().validate():
00665                         id = self.currentRecord().save(reload=True)
00666                 else:
00667                         self.currentView().display(self.currentRecord(), self.group)
00668                         return False
00669                 
00670                 if self.currentView().showsMultipleRecords():
00671                         for record in self.group.modifiedRecords():
00672                                 if record.validate():
00673                                         id = record.save(reload=True)
00674                                 else:
00675                                         self.setCurrentRecord( record )
00676                                         self.display()
00677                                         return False
00678                         self.display()
00679 
00680                 self.display()
00681                 return id
00682 
00683         ## @brief Reload current model and refreshes the view.
00684         #
00685         # If the current view only shows a single record, only the current one will
00686         # be reloaded. If the view shows multiple records it will reload the whole model.
00687         def reload(self):
00688                 if not self.currentView().showsMultipleRecords():
00689                         if self.currentRecord():
00690                                 self.currentRecord().reload()
00691                                 self.display()
00692                         return
00693 
00694                 id = 0
00695                 idx = -1
00696                 if self.currentRecord():
00697                         id = self.currentId()
00698                         idx = self.group.indexOfRecord(self.currentRecord())
00699                         
00700 
00701                 # If we didn't cancel before updating, update may not work if there were modified
00702                 # records. So we first ensure the group is not set as modified and then update/reload
00703                 # it. Note that not cancelling here has other side effects such as that group.sortAll
00704                 # may send a "could not sort" signal and cause an infinite recursion exception.
00705                 self.cancel()
00706                 self.group.update()
00707                 if id:
00708                         record = self.group.modelById( id )
00709                         
00710                         if record:
00711                                 self.setCurrentRecord( record )
00712                         else:
00713                                 # If what it was the current record no longer exists
00714                                 # at least keep index position
00715                                 idx = min( idx, self.group.count() - 1 )
00716                                 if idx >= 0:
00717                                         self.setCurrentRecord( self.group.recordByIndex( idx ) )
00718                                 else:
00719                                         self.setCurrentRecord( None )
00720                 else:
00721                         self.setCurrentRecord( None )
00722                 self.display()
00723 
00724         ## @brief Removes all new records and marks all modified ones as not loaded.
00725         def cancel(self):
00726                 idx = -1
00727                 if self.currentRecord():
00728                         idx = self.group.indexOfRecord( self.currentRecord() )
00729                         
00730                 self.group.cancel()
00731                 if idx != -1:
00732                         idx = min( idx, self.group.count() - 1 )
00733                         if idx >= 0:
00734                                 self.setCurrentRecord( self.group.recordByIndex( idx ) )
00735                         else:
00736                                 self.setCurrentRecord( None )
00737                         self.display()
00738 
00739         ## @brief Returns a reference to the current view.
00740         def currentView(self):
00741                 if self._currentView < 0:
00742                         return None
00743                 type = self._viewQueue.typeFromIndex( self._currentView )
00744                 if not type in self.views:
00745                         (id, type) = self._viewQueue.viewFromType( type )
00746                         self.addViewByIdAndType( id, type )
00747                 return self.views[ type ]
00748 
00749         ## @brief Returns a dictionary with all field values for the current record. 
00750         def get(self):
00751                 if not self.currentRecord():
00752                         return None
00753                 self.currentView().store()
00754                 return self.currentRecord().get()
00755 
00756         ## @brief Returns True if any record has been modified. Returns False otherwise.
00757         def isModified(self):
00758                 if not self.currentRecord():
00759                         return False
00760                 self.currentView().store()
00761                 res = False
00762                 if self.currentView().showsMultipleRecords():
00763                         return self.group.isModified()
00764                 else:
00765                         return self.currentRecord().isModified()
00766 
00767         ## @brief Removes all selected ids.
00768         #
00769         # If unlink is False (the default) records are only removed from the list. If
00770         # unlink is True records will be removed from the server too.
00771         def remove(self, unlink = False):
00772                 records = self.selectedRecords()
00773                 if unlink and records:
00774                         # Remove records with id None as they would cause an exception
00775                         # trying to remove from the server 
00776                         idsToUnlink = [x.id for x in records if x.id != None]
00777                         # It could be that after removing records with id == None
00778                         # there are no records to remove from the database. That is,
00779                         # all records that should be removed are new and not stored yet.
00780                         if idsToUnlink:
00781                                 unlinked = self.rpc.unlink( idsToUnlink )       
00782                                 # Try to be consistent with database
00783                                 # If records could not be removed from the database
00784                                 # don't remove them on the client. Don't report it directly
00785                                 # though as probably an exception (Warning) has already
00786                                 # been shown to the user.
00787                                 if not unlinked:
00788                                         return False
00789 
00790                 if records:
00791                         # Set no current record, so refreshes in the middle of the removal process
00792                         # (caused by signals) do not crash.
00793                         # Note that we want to ensure there are ids to remove so we don't setCurrentRecord(None)
00794                         # if it's not strictly necessary.
00795                         idx = self._currentRecordPosition
00796                         self.setCurrentRecord( None )
00797                         self.group.remove( records )
00798                         if self.group.count():
00799                                 idx = min(idx, self.group.count() - 1)
00800                                 self.setCurrentRecord( self.group.recordByIndex( idx ) )
00801                         else:
00802                                 self.setCurrentRecord( None )
00803                 self.display()
00804                 if records:
00805                         return True
00806                 else:
00807                         return False
00808 
00809         ## @brief Loads the given ids to the RecordGroup and refreshes the view.
00810         def load(self, ids, addOnTop=False):
00811                 self.currentView().reset()
00812                 self.group.load( ids, addOnTop )
00813                 if ids:
00814                         self.display(ids[0])
00815                 else:
00816                         self.setCurrentRecord( None )
00817                         self.display()
00818 
00819         ## @brief Displays the record with id 'id' or refreshes the current record if 
00820         # no id is given.
00821         def display(self, id=None):
00822                 if id:
00823                         self.setCurrentRecord( self.group[id] )
00824                 if self.views:
00825                         self.currentView().setReadOnly( self.isReadOnly() )
00826                         self.currentView().display(self.currentRecord(), self.group)
00827 
00828         ## @brief Moves current record to the next one in the list and displays it in the 
00829         # current view.
00830         def displayNext(self):
00831                 self.currentView().store()
00832                 if self.group.recordExists( self.currentRecord() ):
00833                         idx = self.group.indexOfRecord(self.currentRecord())
00834                         idx = (idx+1) % self.group.count()
00835                         self.setCurrentRecord( self.group.modelByIndex(idx) )
00836                 else:
00837                         self.setCurrentRecord( self.group.count() and self.group.modelByIndex(0) or None )
00838                 if self.currentRecord():
00839                         self.currentRecord().setValidate()
00840                 self.display()
00841 
00842         ## @brief Moves current record to the previous one in the list and displays it in the 
00843         # current view.
00844         def displayPrevious(self):
00845                 self.currentView().store()
00846                 if self.group.recordExists( self.currentRecord() ):
00847                         #idx = self.group.records.index(self.currentRecord())-1
00848                         idx = self.group.indexOfRecord(self.currentRecord())-1
00849                         if idx<0:
00850                                 idx = self.group.count()-1
00851                         self.setCurrentRecord( self.group.modelByIndex(idx) )
00852                 else:
00853                         self.setCurrentRecord( self.group.count() and self.group.modelByIndex(-1) or None )
00854 
00855                 if self.currentRecord():
00856                         self.currentRecord().setValidate()
00857                 self.display()
00858 
00859         ## @brief Returns all selected record ids.
00860         #
00861         # Note that if there are new unsaved records, they might all have 
00862         # ID=None. You're probably looking for selectedRecords() function.
00863         #
00864         # @see selectedRecords
00865         def selectedIds(self):
00866                 records = self.currentView().selectedRecords()
00867                 ids = [record.id for record in records]
00868                 return ids
00869 
00870         ## @brief Returns all selected records
00871         def selectedRecords(self):
00872                 return self.currentView().selectedRecords()
00873 
00874         ## @brief Returns the current record id.
00875         def currentId(self):
00876                 if self.currentRecord():
00877                         return self.currentRecord().id
00878                 else:
00879                         return None
00880 
00881 
00882         ## @brief Clears the list of records and refreshes the view.
00883         #
00884         # Note that this won't remove the records from the database. But clears
00885         # the records from the model. It means that sometimes you might want to
00886         # use setRecordGroup( None ) instead of calling clear(). This is what
00887         # OneToMany and ManyToMany widgets do, for example.
00888         # @see remove()
00889         def clear(self):
00890                 self.group.clear()
00891                 self.display()
00892 
00893         ## @brief Stores settings of all opened views
00894         def storeViewSettings(self):
00895                 for view in self.views.values():
00896                         ViewSettings.store( view.id, view.viewSettings() )
